body.section: List of known issues and workarounds. False measurement after TLS to non-TLS switch After reconfiguring VIP to non-TLS (from TLS), monasca measurements for http_status checks are alternating between '0' and '1' Code Block stack@padawan-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt:~$ monasca --os-username monasca measurement-list --dimensions component=barbican-api,monitored_host_type=vip,api_endpoint=internal --merge_metrics http_status 2016-02-17T20:17:00 +-------------+------------+--------------------------+--------------+------------+ | name | dimensions | timestamp | value | value_meta | +-------------+------------+--------------------------+--------------+------------+ | http_status | | 2016-02-17T20:17:28.000Z | 1.000 | | | | | 2016-02-17T20:17:29.000Z | 0.000 | | | | | 2016-02-17T20:17:29.000Z | 1.000 | | | | | 2016-02-17T20:17:31.000Z | 0.000 | | | | | 2016-02-17T20:17:31.000Z | 1.000 | | | | | 2016-02-17T20:17:57.000Z | 0.000 | | | | | 2016-02-17T20:17:57.000Z | 1.000 | | +---------------------------------------------------------------------------------+ Monasca team has confirmed the above behavior, that both URLs (http and https) are being monitored after the non-TLS switch. They are implementing the fix and plan to have the solution available in HOS 3.0. Edit the control plane definition file i.e. ~/helion/my_cloud/definition/data/control_plane.yml Make changes to add barbican service components if not already there (Above sample configuration can be followed) Commit the change in git repository. cd ~/helion/hos/ansible/ ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost config-processor-run.yml ansible-playbook -i hosts/localhost ready-deployment.yml cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts site.yml
